title: CryptoHeadlineNews
author: CryptoHeadlineNews
content: Greetings to everyone, please its been 2days now since I started experiencing my forum account getting logged out, and I'm kind of worried, and I really don't know why, and I thought It's better I come share this out here to know of is it a general problem? Or am I the only one experiencing this? Please and please I need your advice, because as a result of that I have just gone to change my password and Gmail, to avoid any such of hack, but I keep experiencing the same situations. So on that note, I will like to call on the attention of some reputable forum members I have always looked up to since day one on possible advice on what to do, and by that I mean in the person ofÂ  @ Loyce, TryNinja, Rikafip, Nutildah, Pmalek and lastly Sir Theymos. Thanks in advance as I wait for your solution.Please Note: I'm a Nigerian and will always remain a Nigerian on this forum for the rest of my life, and likewise will I continue using this Bitcoin wallet address below that I have been using for the past 2yrs on this forum til further notice. ThanksBTC address (Segwit)- bc1q569t82xygdh62d6f0lduedq4k9nk42s0ljcvvsSo, please am I the only one experiencing the forum log out or it's general??

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: I never experience like this one, any chance you didn't check "Always stay logged in"? by default the forum only let you stay for 60 minutes and you will get logged out automatically. If we talk about virus, I don't think it's only make you logged out, usually your device will be controlled by someone else and you can't do anything.Although your Bitcoin address was been used since 2022, but it's better if you can sign a message.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Did you checked always stay logged in when you wanted to login the last time? If you did not check always stay logged in, you will automatically be logged out at the time specified. Check always stay login.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Are you using incognito mode? Are you clearing your cookies/cache and history from your browser? How does it happen exactly? You're just browsing the forum, and then you refresh to find yourself logged out?

I haven't experienced such, it means it's peculiar to you too. But you can't experience this due to your nationality or a Bitcoin address. You, writing them out is not necessary.Before the likes of those you called out share their view, you might want to be sure that you do not use VPN or Tor, or private mode of browsers. Also, be certain that you click on "Always stay logged in" to keep you on. You might also want to delete your browser cookies and caches. You may try logging in on another browser as well.

Bitcointalk does not send any cookies link for someone to accept or reject. I do not really know about how cookies can be related to this. I may not be exactly right.If you visit a website, you look for an item on the website. If you visit the website again, you will easily see similar items again. The cookies stored on your browser makes that possible. Also if you visit another website, you will be seeing similar items and also you will see ads of the item on another sites. comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: First, change your user password.When you change it, sign a Bitcoin message with a Bitcoin private key of a public address you use.The sign message and the public address can help you to recover your account later, if it is hacked or if you forget its password.How to sign a Bitcoin messageStake your Bitcoin address hereYour account will be logged out if a second device logs in, the first device will log out and I understand your panic.Did you check your login IP history?https://bitcointalk.org/myips.phpDo you see any strange IP address?
